clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Cardiac Pathologies on Thoracic CT
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Cardiac Pathologies in Thoracic CT Using Individualised Contrast Media Protocols and Ultra High-Pitch Mode [CaPaCT-2]

brief_summary.textblock:
New technical developments make ultra-fast non-electrocardiogram (ECG) triggered scan acquisition with a high temporal resolution possible, which can be used for the evaluation of cardiac pathologies on a standard thoracic Computed Tomography (CT) scans.
Current studies have shown that it is possible to assess the heart and it's coronary arteries on standard ultra-high pitch thoracic CT, which could result in incidental or new cardiac findings. However, to be able to perform a complete cardiopulmonary assessment on a thoracic CT scan, the injection protocol and bolus tracking settings could be optimised for both aortic and pulmonary vasculature (e.g. sufficient attenuation in pulmonary arteries, pulmonary trunk and ascending aorta).
Therefore, the aim of the study is to evaluate the presence and extent of coronary artery disease, valvular morphology and calcification, pericardial abnormalities, and cardiac size on a standard ultra-high pitch thoracic CT-scan with individualised injection protocols.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of subjective and objective image quality based on individualized thoracic CT protocols
Evaluation of the performance of optimised injection protocols with regard to the detection of coronary artery disease on standard thoracic CT-scans

secondary_outcome.measure: Detection rate and presence of coronary artery disease (CAD)
secondary_outcome.description: Detection rate of presence of CAD and comparison to detection rate on standard CT scans without contrast optimisation
Comparing the individualised tube voltage settings with regard to contrast media (CM) volume reduction

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive patients referred for thoracic CT-scanning.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Standard non-ECG triggered thoracic CT scanning.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe allergy against Iopromide or any of the ingredients,
- Previous severe CM reaction (according to current European Society of Urogenital Radiology (ESUR) guidelines),
- Renal insufficiency, pregnancy.
